translation.title_en: Ailey Math [Forced Code Execution] Patch Notes (v0111)
translation.content_en:
# Ailey Math with tools

0. Added configuration addon (Do not register in Gems; only functional in base settings)
1. Forced Code Execution (Enhances the model's mathematical performance)

# How to Apply to Base Settings
Download the TXT file (for base settings), delete the content inside the yellow circle, and click Submit. (â€» If it fails, clear everything, re-paste, and try again. â€»)

CSAT Math Scores in Fast Mode with Web Code Execution - Singularity is Near Minor Gallery
Note: Calculus Problem No. 30 remains unsolvable.
Fast Mode scores without code execution: 2026 Odd Year: CSAT: Common Math: 1-22

Gemini - direct access to Google AI
Created with Gemini
gemini.google.com
gall.dcinside.com

â€» Please follow the usage instructions â€»

# Usage
Good Example: "Draw a graph using Python" (Base Settings)
@ Code execution rates may decrease during prolonged sessions.
@ Can be registered concurrently with Search Mode.

[Prompt Share] Integrated Prompt Archive (v0111) - Singularity is Near Minor Gallery
LAST UPDATE 26.01.11 11:44 #1 Added forced code execution and base setting support.
gall.dcinside.com

Developer GitHub
âœ¨ Support Page âœ¨

structured.content_en:
Your AI is still failing at math. The Singularity Gallery has released a prompt that forces code execution. Using this tool, Gemini's CSAT math scores have improved significantly.

## What Happened
A dedicated prompt that forces "code execution" in Gemini has emerged. The "Ailey Math" tool utilizes Python code to correct calculation errors. It recorded a high accuracy rate in the common mathematics section of the CSAT (College Scholastic Ability Test). Users improve performance by inserting specific text into the default settings.

## Why It Matters
This provides a clue to solving the chronic calculation errors of Large Language Models (LLMs). Performance is now determined by tool-use capability rather than simple text generation. It presents practical standards for AI utilization for both students and developers.

## Background
Existing AI models have shown limitations in complex calculus operations. While Geminiâ€™s fast mode is quick, its computational accuracy remains low. Developers have combined Python graph visualization with forced code execution. This method maximizes the model's logical reasoning capabilities.

## Future Outlook
AI will perform precise calculations beyond mere mathematical reasoning. It will be deployed to solve high-difficulty engineering problems, not just the CSAT. Prompt engineering will evolve into a more sophisticated form of tool control.

## FAQ
**Q: Where should I put the code?**
A: Paste the content into the TXT area of Geminiâ€™s custom settings.

**Q: Does it solve all math problems?**
A: Limitations still exist for ultra-high-difficulty problems, such as Calculus Question 30.

**Q: Is the performance difference significant?**
A: There is a clear difference in the accuracy rate depending on whether Python code is executed.
